body.name: TheTiger's Prey: A Novel of Adventure
body.description: The New York Times best-selling author of Desert God and Pharaoh adds another chapter to his popular historical saga featuring the seafaring Tom Courtney, the hero of Monsoon and Blue Horizon, with this magnificent swashbuckling saga set in the 18th century and packed with action, violence, romance, and rousing adventure. Tom Courtney, one of four sons of master mariner Sir Hal Courtney, once again sets sail on a treacherous journey that will take him across the vast reaches of the ocean and pit him against dangerous enemies in exotic destinations. But just as the winds propel his sails, passion drives his heart. Turning his ship toward the unknown, Tom Courtney will ultimately find his destiny - and lay the future for the Courtney family. Wilbur Smith, the world's greatest storyteller, once again recreates all the drama, uncertainty, and courage of a bygone era in this thrilling saga of the sea. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes you want to read
reviews.reviewText: I wish they would’ve had Wilbur Smith books required reading in school. It sure makes you want to read you can’t put it down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good book.
reviews.reviewText: I have read a lot of the Courtney family novels by Wilbur Smith and have enjoyed them all. Smith never fails to excite the reader and his Courtney family series does just that. Smith's books are very hard to put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Continuing saga log Tom Courtney. Wilber Smith was one great author for adventure stories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Tigers prey
reviews.reviewText: Wilbur Smith is a great writer. Very interesting story of the early years of East India Company and sea trade. You find a great character in Tom Courteny. The Story line with sea trade, Pirates , East India company, the queen, King Sahuji make for non stop reading. A good book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Usual delightful Wilbur Smith
reviews.reviewText: I very much enjoyed this book, as I have all his other books! I do have to admit that, for the first time, I felt the book was formulaic - just like many of the others. Very predictable, but still a fun read. Mostly, I love that his books are well researched in terms of locations and times, and this one did not fail to give me new insights into the world!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The books with a co-writer do not have the same quality of the firsts ones
reviews.reviewText: The following passage is technically wrong. "“For no man has yet devised a way to measure longitude, though many of the finest minds have tried,” he explained to Francis (this statement is correct). “The sun can tell us how far east or west we have gone, but not how much north or south. For that, we can only estimate that by our speed and our heading.” It is the opposite, the sun can tell us how much north or south we have gone (the latitude) and not how far east or west (the longitude). It is a small mistake that could be corrected in a new edition.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars another great WIlbur Smith adventure
reviews.reviewText: What can I say another great adventure from Wilbur SmithIf you are just staring to read his books make sure you look to see the order to read them

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better Than Desert God
reviews.reviewText: Since Mr. Smith stopped writing his own books, it's been a gamble finding a good one. This one, The Tiger's Prey, was better than the last one I read, Desert God. The author, Tom Harper, told a pretty good yarn with some of the panache we came to expect from Mr. Smith. The timeline and the characters' backstory are on point, and the action is rather well done; more reminiscent of Smith of yore.

reviews.reviewTitle: Intrigue du début à la fin
reviews.reviewText: L’histoire nous transporte dans des endroits intéressants et nous tient en suspense.
Had to read to the end and I could not put it down. As always WS always delivers. Also a proper ending, just a little cliff hanger!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: As ever the writing of a Wilbur Smith has not failed to disappoint to keep readers do spell bound with the writing and description of the land and adventures of The Courtney family.
I rediscovered Wilbur Smith with Assegai! Have caught up with further adventures of his interesting characters.

reviews.reviewTitle: One good from mr Smith again.
reviews.reviewText: So nice that even the book is new you can go back to earlier books of the same thema and continue this exiting story.
